original: 10 Indriyayamaka
analyzed: indriya yamaka
translated: The Twin Verses on Faculties

original: 10.3 Pariññāvāra🔽10.3.5. Paccuppannānāgatavāra
analyzed: pariññāvāra
translated: The Chapter on Full Understanding🔽The Section on the Present and Future

original: 10.3.5.1. Anuloma🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti? No.
analyzed: anuloma  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati iti no
translated: The Direct Path🔽“He who fully understands the eye faculty abandons the faculty of grief” …

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam pajahissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: “He who abandons the faculty of grief fully understands the eye faculty” …🔽“He who fully understands the eye faculty develops the faculty ‘I am possessed of knowledge and vision’ ” …

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvessati so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: “He who develops the faculty ‘I am possessed of knowledge and vision’ fully understands the eye faculty” …🔽“He who fully understands the eye faculty develops the faculty of final knowledge” …

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: “He who develops the faculty of final knowledge fully understands the eye faculty” …🔽“He who fully understands the eye faculty realizes the fruit of true knowledge and liberation” …

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti
translated: “He who realizes the fruit of true knowledge and liberation fully understands the eye faculty” …

original: Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ parijānanti.
analyzed: satta puggalāḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissanti no ca cakkhu indriyam parijānanti
translated: Seven persons will realize the faculty of final knowledge, but they will not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissati cakkhundriyañca parijānāti. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissati cakkhu indriyañca parijānāti cakkhu indriya mūlaka  yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: One who possesses the path of arahantship will realize the faculty of final knowledge and will fully understand the eye faculty.🔽“Whoever abandons the sorrow faculty …🔽“Whoever develops the final-knower faculty …

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahati iti no  yaḥ domanassindriyam pajahati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: “Whoever abandons the sorrow faculty will develop the final-knower faculty”: one can say “yes”.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahati iti
translated: “Whoever develops the final-knower faculty will abandon the sorrow faculty”:

original: Cha puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahanti anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī aññindriyañca bhāvessati, domanassindriyañca pajahati.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyam pajahanti anāgāmi magga samaṅgī aññindriyam ca bhāvessati domanassindriyam ca pajahati
translated: six persons will develop the final-knower faculty, but they will not abandon the sorrow faculty. One who possesses the path of non-return will develop the final-knower faculty and will abandon the sorrow faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahati saḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: “Whoever abandons the sorrow faculty will realize the faculty of final knowledge”: one can say “yes”.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who will realize the final-knowledge-faculty abandon the grief-faculty?

original: Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahanti.
analyzed: satta puggalāḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissanti no ca domanassindriyam pajahanti
translated: Seven persons will realize the final-knowledge-faculty, but they do not abandon the grief-faculty.

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissati domanassindriyañca pajahati.
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissati domanassindriyañca pajahati
translated: One who possesses the Non-Returner Path will realize the final-knowledge-faculty and will abandon the grief-faculty.

original: (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: domanassindriya mūlaka  yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāveti saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: (The grief-faculty is the root.)🔽“He who develops the final-knowledge-faculty will he develop the knowledge-faculty?” Unreservedly.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāveti iti
translated: “Or does anyone who will develop the knowledge-faculty develop the final-knowledge-faculty?”

original: Cha puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāventi. Aṭṭhamako aññindriyañca bhāvessati anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāveti.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāventi aṭṭhamakaḥ aññindriyam ca bhāvessati anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam ca bhāveti
translated: Six persons will develop the knowledge-faculty, but they do not develop the final-knowledge-faculty. The eighth person will develop the knowledge-faculty and will develop the final-knowledge-faculty.

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāveti saḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: “He who develops the final-knowledge-faculty will he realize the final-knowledge-faculty?” Unreservedly.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāveti iti
translated: Or does anyone who will realize the final-knowledge-faculty develop the I-am-not-without-knowledge-faculty?

original: Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāventi.
analyzed: satta puggalāḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissanti no ca anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāventi
translated: Seven persons will realize the final-knowledge-faculty, but they do not develop the I-am-not-without-knowledge-faculty.

original: Aṭṭhamako aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissati anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāveti.
analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ aññātau indriyañca sacchikarissati an aññāta ñassāmi iti indriyañca bhāveti
translated: The eighth person will realize the final-knowledge-faculty and will develop the I-am-not-without-knowledge-faculty.

original: (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo aññindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: an añña a taññaḥ sāmi iti indriya mūlaka  yaḥ aññindriyam bhāveti saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: (The I-am-not-without-knowledge-faculty is the root.)🔽Does anyone who develops the final-knowledge-faculty realize the final-knowledge-faculty?

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam bhāveti iti
translated: Or does anyone who will realize the final-knowledge-faculty develop the final-knowledge-faculty?

original: Pañca puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca aññindriyaṁ bhāventi. Tayo maggasamaṅgino aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti aññindriyañca bhāventi. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: pañca puggalā aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissanti no ca aññindriyam bhāventi tayo magga samaṅgino aññātāvindriyam ca sacchikarissanti aññindriyam ca bhāventi aññindriya mūlaka
translated: Five persons will realize the final-knowledge-faculty, but they do not develop the final-knowledge-faculty. Three persons who are provided with the path will realize the final-knowledge-faculty and will develop the final-knowledge-faculty. (The final-knowledge-faculty is the root.)

original: 10.3.5.2. Paccanīka
analyzed: paccanīka
translated: .... The opposite

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti
translated: Does anyone who does not fully understand the eye-faculty abandon the grief-faculty?

original: Pañca puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissanti. Cattāro puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti.
analyzed: pañca puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānanti no ca domanassindriyam na pajahissanti cattāro puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti domanassindriyam ca na pajahissanti
translated: Five kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty, but they will abandon the grief faculty. Four kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and they will not abandon the grief faculty.

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam na pajahissati so cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, if someone will not abandon the grief faculty, does he not fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti. Cattāro puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī domanassindriyam na pajahissati no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānāti cattāro puggalā domanassindriyam ca na pajahissanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānanti
translated: One who possesses the path of no-more-training will not abandon the grief faculty, but he does fully understand the eye faculty. Four kinds of persons will not abandon the grief faculty and they do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?🔽Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti  ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te cakkhu indriyam na parijānanti no ca
translated: If someone does not fully understand the eye faculty, does he not develop the faculty of final knowledge?

original: na bhāvessanti. Aṭṭha puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: na bhāvessanti aṭṭha puggalā cakkhu indriyañca na parijānanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti
translated: Those ordinary people who will obtain the path do not fully understand the eye faculty, but they will develop the faculty of final knowledge. Eight kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and they do not develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati so cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti  agga magga samaṅgī anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāvessati no ca cakkhu indriyam na
translated: Or does anyone who does not develop the final-knowledge-of-the-course-of-ideas faculty understand the eye faculty?

original: parijānāti. Aṭṭha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: parijānāti aṭṭha puggalāḥ cakkhu indriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhu indriyañca na parijānanti
translated: One who possesses the path of the highest fruit does not develop the final-knowledge-of-the-course-of-ideas faculty, but he does understand the eye faculty. Eight persons do not develop the final-knowledge-of-the-course-of-ideas faculty and do not understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: Does anyone who does not understand the eye faculty not develop the other-knowing faculty?

original: Satta puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Dve puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: satta puggalā cakkhundriyam na parijānanti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti dve puggalā cakkhundriyam ca na parijānanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Seven persons do not understand the eye faculty, but they do develop the other-knowing faculty. Two persons do not understand the eye faculty and do not develop the other-knowing faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati so cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who does not develop the other-knowing faculty not understand the eye faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti. Dve puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññindriyam na bhāvessati no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānāti dve puggalā aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānanti
translated: One who possesses the path of Stream-Entry does not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but he does not fail to fully understand the eye faculty. Two kinds of persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge and do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “Those who do not fully understand the eye faculty, do they not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Satta puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti. Dve puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: satta puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānanti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti dve puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: Seven kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty, but they do realize the faculty of final knowledge. Two kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and do not realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti āmantā cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: “But those who do not realize the faculty of final knowledge, do they not fully understand the eye faculty?”

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: “Those who do not abandon the faculty of grief, do they not develop the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyaṁ nappajahanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyam na ppajahanti no ca
translated: Those who are ordinary men and who will obtain the path, they do not abandon the faculty of grief, but they do not develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: na bhāvessanti. Aṭṭha puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: na bhāvessanti aṭṭha puggalā domanassindriyañca na ppajahanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti
translated: eight persons do not abandon the painful feeling faculty and do not develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati so domanassindriyam na ppajahati iti
translated: Or, does anyone who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge not abandon the painful feeling faculty?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca domanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāvessati no ca domanassindriya
translated: The non-returner who possesses the path does not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but he does not abandon the painful feeling faculty.

original: nappajahati. Aṭṭha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca nappajahanti.
analyzed: na pajahati aṭṭha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca na ppajahanti
translated: Eight persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge and do not abandon the painful feeling faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: Does anyone who does not abandon the painful feeling faculty not develop the faculty of the acquired?

original: Cha puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahanti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Tayo puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cha puggalā domanassindriyam na ppajahanti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti tayo puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Six persons do not abandon the painful feeling faculty, but they do not not develop the faculty of the acquired. Three persons do not abandon the painful feeling faculty and do not develop the faculty of the acquired.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati iti āmantā
translated: Or, does anyone who does not develop the faculty of the acquired not abandon the painful feeling faculty?

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “He who does not abandon the sorrow faculty …

original: Satta puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahanti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti. Dve puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.🔽Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti? Āmantā. (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: satta puggalā domanassindriyam na ppajahanti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti dve puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti  yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati iti āmantā domanassindriya mūlaka
translated: Seven persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty, but they will realize the final knowledge. Two persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty and they will not realize the final knowledge.🔽“He who does not realize the final-knowledge faculty …

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: “He who does not develop the final-knowledge faculty …

original: Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāventi, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Tayo puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāventi aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāventi no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti tayo puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam ca na bhāventi aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Six persons do not develop the final-knowledge faculty, but they will realize the final-knowledge. Three persons do not develop the final-knowledge faculty and they will not realize the final-knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti iti āmantā
translated: “He who does not realize the final-knowledge faculty …

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?🔽Satta puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāventi, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati iti  satta puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāventi no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti
translated: “He who does not develop the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the unknown’ will he not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽Seven persons do not develop the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the unknown,’ but they will realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: dve puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam ca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: Two persons neither develop the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the unknown’ nor will they realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti? Āmantā. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāveti iti āmantā anaññātaññassāmi iti indriya mūlaka
translated: “He who will not realize the faculty of final knowledge, does he not develop the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the unknown’?”🔽Five persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but they will realize the faculty of final knowledge. Two persons neither develop the faculty of final knowledge nor will they realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo aññindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ aññindriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge, will he not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Pañca puggalā aññindriyaṁ na bhāventi, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti. Dve puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: pañca puggalāḥ aññindriyam na bhāventi no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti dve puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: Five persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but they will realize the faculty of final knowledge. Two persons neither develop the faculty of final knowledge nor will they realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti? Āmantā. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāveti iti āmantā aññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, he who will not realize the final-knower faculty, will he not develop the final-knower faculty? Reply: Yes.
